title: Phishing Analysis Challenge 1
instructions:
You are a SOC Analayst at Mighty Solutions, Inc. An account executive, Dana Derringer, noticed a warning email in her inbox claiming her online access has been disabled. However, she noticed this was odd as she is still able to access her online business platforms and inbox. She decided to forward the email in question to the security team's phishing mailbox for review.

Using what you've learned within this domain, perform a detailed email analysis on the challenge1.eml file to answer the report questions below.

Challenge File:

  • 01_Phishing_Analysis/06_Challenges/challenge1.eml

questions.question: Based on the contents of the email header, what was the full date and time of the email delivery?
questions.hint: Check the contents of the Date header.

questions.question: What is the subject of the email?
questions.hint: Check the contents of the Subject header.
correct_answers: Your account has been flagged for unusual activity

questions.question: Who was the email sent to?
questions.hint: Check the contents of the To header.

questions.question: Based on the sender's display name, who does the email claim to be from?
questions.hint: Check the contents of the From header. Specifically, the display name portion.

questions.question: What is the sender's email address?
questions.hint: Check the contents of the From header. Specifically, the email address portion.

questions.question: What is the email address to which bounced emails will be sent?
questions.hint: This is also sometimes known as the bounce address or the reverse path.

questions.question: What is the sender's IP address?
questions.hint: Look for the IP address within the Received headers or within a custom X-Header.

questions.question: What is the resolved hostname of the sender's IP address?
questions.hint: Perform a reverse DNS lookup on the previously identified IP address.
